quotes: They say evil prevails when good men fail to act. What they ought to say is: evil prevails.
Yuri Orlov
There are only two tragedies in life. One is not getting what you want; the other is getting it.
Yuri Orlov
That's the secret to survival: never go to war; especially with yourself.
Yuri Orlov
Lying is a delightful thing for it leads to the truth.
Fyodor Dostoyevsky
To go wrong in one's own way is better than to go right in someone else's.
Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Right or wrong, it's very pleasant to break something from time to time.
Fyodor Dostoyevsky
So long as man remains free he strives for nothing so incessantly and so painfully as to find someone to worship.
Fyodor Dostoyevsky
There is no subject so old that nothing new can be said about it.
Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Nothing is more seductive to a man than his freedom of conscience, but nothing is a greater cause of suffering.
Fyodor Dostoyevsky
When in doubt, Meriadoc, always follow your nose.
Gandalf
